message.content:
cs.SI, cs.CL, cs.SOC, cs.LG, cs.IR

Reasoning: 
1. cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) - The paper focuses on modeling the diffusion of news stories in social networks, which falls under the scope of social and information networks.
2. cs.CL (Computation and Language) - The paper uses natural language processing techniques to model the topics of news stories, which falls under the scope of computation and language.
3. cs.SOC (Computational Social Science) - The paper uses a social network dataset to train and evaluate the proposed model, which falls under the scope of computational social science.
4. cs.LG (Machine Learning) - The paper proposes a novel Bayesian nonparametric model to predict the labels of news stories, which falls under the scope of machine learning.
5. cs.IR (Information Retrieval) - The paper uses a Gaussian process latent variable model to discover the homogeneity values of news stories, which falls under the scope of information retrieval.
